user_instruction: 'Compose an email to Emily (emily@communityunited.org), the head of non-profit to discuss how we can boost our donation effort. You can check out my Gmail and Notion for information.'

formatted_items.content:
Here’s a concise recap of the material I found that’s most relevant to your upcoming outreach email to Emily:

GMAIL THREADS
1. “Innovative Donation Strategies” (Jan 22 2022)  
   • You proposed exploring digital campaigns, gamification, local-business partnerships, and recurring-giving programs.  
   • Emily hasn’t replied in that thread yet, so you could easily revisit these ideas.

2. “Joint Fundraiser Planning” (Feb 8 2022)  
   • Key points you raised: venue/date, a concrete fundraising-goal figure, and publicity tactics.  
   • It’s a good reference for re-stating or updating shared targets and timelines.

3. “Re: Fundraising Gala Success” (Feb 15 2022)  
   • Post-event kudos and an offer to help with donor follow-ups.  
   • Useful as a talking point when you reference past collaboration wins.

NOTION WORKSPACE
• Page: “Fundraising Event Ideas”  
  https://www.notion.so/Fundraising-Event-Ideas-2180dc8fa0db81d9a885ef343d7af3f0  
  – Brainstorming notes (created Jun 20 2025) include:  
     ◦ Virtual marathon with sign-up fee  
     ◦ Online concert featuring local artists  
     ◦ Community art auction  
     ◦ Sponsorship opportunities with local businesses

(There were no detailed metrics or written summaries of last year’s drives in Notion; if those exist elsewhere, they aren’t tagged clearly with Community United keywords.)

NEXT STEPS
1. Review the above Gmail threads for exact wording or data you may want to quote.  
2. Skim the Notion brainstorming page for any ideas you’d like to include or refine.  
3. If you need deeper numbers (e.g., total dollars raised last year, donor retention rates), let me know and I’ll do a broader search by date or campaign code.

Let me know if you’d like me to forward any of these individual emails or extract specific figures.
